byline.contributor: Floyd Whaley reported from Davao City, and Richard C. Paddock from Manila.
byline.original: By FLOYD WHALEY and RICHARD C. PADDOCK

abstract: Rodrigo Duterte, mayor of Davao City, Philippines, and unconventional candidate for president, appears poised to win election, with ongoing tally showing that he has so far earned 39 percent of vote; Duterte's sometimes crass comments and dark history of overseeing 1,000 extrajudicial killings during his time as mayor stand at odds with good deeds and soft side reported by his constituents.
lead_paragraph: As Mr. Duterte appears poised to become the country’s next president, people who know him well say the depiction of him as a crass vigilante is an oversimplification.

headline.main: Rodrigo Duterte’s Many Sides: Brash and Crude or Tough and Shrewd
headline.print_headline: Vigilante Leader With a Soft Side

snippet: As Mr. Duterte appears poised to become the country’s next president, people who know him well say the depiction of him as a crass vigilante is an oversimplification.
